inn1.comm: full outside off, 130kph, hint of swing, left alone
allowed to go through outside off
tighter on off stump, van Wyk walks forward into his defensive push which finds cover
close! Gets away with it. Fortune for van Wyk, it's a length ball around off stump, it may have nipped back just a touch and took an inside edge which scooted past the stumps to fine leg
short of a length on leg stump, deflected behind square
neatly played, too straight from Cottrell with fine leg inside the circle. Rossouw just gets inside the line and tucks it off his hip
decent start, full outside off, 126kph and left alone
full on middle and off, pushed to mid on
left alone outside off
shorter and wider, pushed into the off side without any great venom
nice delivery, left on length as much as line...the ball carries over the top of off stump. That's some trust on this ground
dragged down short and at not much more the medium pace that sits up which allows van Wyk to roll his wrists and pull it backward of deep square leg
low full toss outside, driven to cover...they try to take an overthrow after the return comes in but the umpire says the ball was already dead
a huge full toss down the leg side, awful delivery, no chance for Ramdin and that goes straight to fine leg

what a comeback and what a catch! That was the perfect delivery. Full outside off, hint of swing away from the left hander who pushed away from his body. The edge was dying as it headed towards first slip, but Sammy saw it and dived across full length to hold a screamer. Cottrell brings out his salute.
short outside off, going across du Plessis who leaves it alone
poor delivery, short again and down the leg side this time...he needs to remember the wicket delivery
gets this one full outside off, 137kph, du Plessis comes into the front foot and drives to mid off
pushed across wide outside off, left alone
a little closer to off stump, back of a length, carries at waist height to Ramdin
back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
that's a good delivery, full outside off and comes back into du Plessis which makes it a reasonably tight leave in the end
a more comfortable one to let through to the keeper
offers up some width and that's put away through point with a strong cut shot...Holder not impressed by the lack of a dive from Smith
defended back to the bowler
advancing down the pitch, it's short of a length and in the end he leaves it alone
full outside off, angled across, left alone
angled into the pads, bobbles towards square leg
tucked into the leg side
very full outside off, du Plessis leans forward and drives but doesn't find his timing
some movement there, back into du Plessis from back of a length, the bottom hand comes off the bat as he plays to cover
too short outside off, sits up on a pitch without much pace, du Plessis plays it off the back foot wide of mid-off
back of a length around off stump, defended to point
a little fuller, he comes forward and defends to the covers

dragged down short again...oh dear, another woeful piece of fielding and it's Smith (again). This time he's at deep square but the ball follows him as van Wyk helps the ball off his hip with a well-controlled pull. He didn't move very quickly and then barely seemed bothered to bend down
full outside off, left alone
angled into the pads, tucked to deep square and this time there's a bit more commitment from Smith

oh boy, what a catch! Another ripper. Du Plessis edges a full delivery, seemed to be aiming leg side, and for a moment Ramdin appears a little wrong-footed but then flings himself low to his right, with one glove, and snaffles the catch. Terrific reflexes.
full outside off, he drives and it skews off a thick outside edge to point

and another! Flying Ramdin again. Well, well. It wasn't a great delivery, short and outside off, van Wyk chases it but the shot is neither a drive or a cut and the edge is grabbed one-handed by Ramdin diving in front of first slip. He had more time to see that catch, as the ball was shorter, but it was still another smart grab
that's all wrong for a first ball, they keep finding the edge but he flings down a very short bouncer which loops over the batsman and the keeper
full on the stumps, but angling into the pads and it's nicely clipped backward of square giving fine leg no chance
gets his line back outside off, still a hint of swing, pushed to point with an open face
fuller outside off, too wide, left alone
full at off stump, punched back down the pitch
good length outside off, he shoulders arms
nicely bowled, full on off stump, defended with a straight bat to mid off
touch shorter, outside off, played with soft hands into the off side
full outside off, 127kph, left alone...Holder is in a decent rhythm
what a beauty! That is a cracking delivery to beat de Villiers. Just short of a good length, angled in then nips away off the pitch. Bottle that one
tight on off stump, defended to point. A maiden to de Villiers which is no mean feat, whatever the situation
that's where he wants to be, full at off stump, defended towards the on side
back of a length outside off, punched neatly into the covers
another one past the edge, full outside off and Miller is slightly hesitant as he comes onto the front foot although it was the late movement which beat him
shorter and wider, left alone
goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss which is clipped to mid on
not entirely in control as he drives at this full ball, it squirts off the outer part of the bat through point although was always along the ground
he's off the mark, and it's a short ball which costs runs again as de Villiers gets onto his toes and cuts in front of point
goes fuller, still wide but left alone
nearly gets him fiddling outside off, was wide enough to leave but de Villiers pushed away from his body and the late swing beat the edge
short of a length, clipped to deep square
full and straight, clipped to deep square
full outside off, 128kph, left alone
starts on a length at off stump, defended down the off side
gets across outside off and defends to the on side
on off stump, 139kph, defended into the covers
he's moving right across the crease, defends with an open face to backward point
a little shorter, he plays it off the back foot to the on side
pushed across full outside off, left alone, and he starts with a maiden
short of a length outside, whipped into midwicket
an appeal for lbw as Miller shuffles across his crease but that pitched outside leg
nicely played, was fuller from Sammy and Miller flicked this off around middle and off through straight midwicket
now he punches off the back foot to the cover sweeper
on off stump, defended to the covers

dropped, but it wasn't easy. AB de Villiers chipped down the pitch and popped a catch above Sammy's head in his follow through, he got his hands up there but couldn't grasp the ball. And it still rolls away for four

where did that come from?! This climbs from short of a length at 142kph, Miller gets into a tangle as he tries to play the ball and it takes the shoulder of the bat but loops over the slip as he ran backwards. That was a sharp delivery
short again, de Villiers much more in control as he pulls to long leg
costs a boundary, but this wasn't a bad delivery. Miller driving a length ball on the up and it flies over backward point. Certainly not in control
driven to mid off
short of a length outside off, chopped down in front of slip
shorter again, de Villiers plays it down into the off side by the edge of the pitch and they scamper a single
short of a length outside off, 118kph and appears to hold in the pitch a little
gets across onto off stump and pushes down the ground to long on
punched off the back foot square through point
fuller outside off, driven square and point dives over the top of it
worked off the pads to deep square
full at off stump, slides off the face into the covers
pushed into the off side
shorter outside off, cut to cover
angled onto leg stump and that's easy for de Villiers as he clips it through midwicket

got him! Huge wicket! A good delivery from Russell, back of a length and it just nips back a touch, too, as it finds de Villiers' inside edge. He was well across his crease by the time he played that. Neat catch from Ramdin
short of a length on off stump, 137kph, defended back to the bowler
defended with a slightly open face and the ball runs to backward point
full at off stump, 123kph, defended
very full, at the popping crease, driven to cover
ooh, a shorter delivery, comes off a thick inside edge and bounces not a million miles away from the stumps
drives a full ball to the left of mid-off
takes this delivery from outside off and drives to mid on
jabs down on a full delivery to end a decent opening over from Brathwaite
banged in short, angled in from outside off, Miller drops his hands and sways out of the line
back of a length, driven through the covers to the sweeper
short delivery, Duminy plays it at the top bounce into the off side
fuller outside off, 137kph, left alone

well bowled! Takes him on the helmet. A lively short delivery, he's really worked up good pace, and it's fended at quite awkwardly by Duminy with his hands in front of his face. Gets struck on the helmet and he rebounds to the leg side
another good short and neither goes Miller look very comfortable as he jabs at it
onto the front foot and drives to cover
angled across outside off, left alone
lets this one go through as wlel
well bowled! Nearly finds the edge. Duminy driving on the up, the ball wasn't that full and it climbed past the bat
that's a more controlled drive, the front foot came out further and the ball was a touch fuller...finds mid off
driven square through point
short of a length, Duminy gets inside the line and tucks into square leg
short outside off and beautifully put away with a punchy back-foot drive through the covers
flicks this from outside off to mid on
short outside off and another terrific stroke, the ball sits up nicely this time, less venom, Miller rolls his wrists on the pull and sends it in front of square
short over off stump, drops his gloves and leaves it alone
round the wicket, back of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
on off stump, Duminy forward and defends to the covers
short of a length, tucked into the leg side
full on the stumps, slides off the face into the point area
good running, Miller calls Duminy through for a tight one as this is fended down by the crease. Brathwaite followed through to field and Miller had to get the dive out but was pretty safe in the end
full on middle and off, defended to the off side, Brathwaite skips across the field and hurls the ball back to Ramdin
defended to mid-off
round the wicket, short outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
low full toss, pushed down the ground
tucks a length ball into the leg side
better delivery, full on off stump, Miller defends with quite hard hands
some turn there, was quite wide and Duminy chased it without making contact
some turn there, was quite wide and Duminy chased it without making contact
short of a length, angled across Miller who runs it down to third man with an open face
dabbed with soft hands towards the vacant slip area, Ramdin can't stop the single
short and pulled out to deep square
opens the face down to third man
changes to round the wicket, full on off stump, defended to mid off
direct hit from mid off, but Miller is quick and makes it hope. He struck the ball sweetly but ran with the shot
driven down to long off
short outside off, cut well in front of square but Carter does well to get around the cover boundary
dabbed into the off side
good stride forward but doesn't beat cover
shorter, played to backward point
drives out to the cover sweeper
beats the outside edge as he plays a forcing shot off the back foot to a short-of-a-length delivery
fuller, defended to backward point
comes forward and pushes to cover
dragged down short outside off, Miller pulls firmly but picks out Gayle at midwicket
full outside off, 133kph, left alone
back of a length outside off, defended towards mid off...good over, a maiden
over the wicket, outside off, left alone
pushed into the leg side
very deft shot, waited for the ball outside off then dabbed it fine of short third man
swept from an off-stump line, or even outside off, connects very quickly and sends it whistling to deep square
sweeps again, or more of a paddle this time, the ball was even wider outside off but he manages to get it fine of short fine leg...back-to-back boundaries
back round the wicket, quicker ball, pushed to the off side
length just outside off, played forward, nudged towards point
fuller length, low full toss in fact, driven very nicely down the ground and timed well enough to beat mid-off
on a length back just outside off, punched to deep cover
tighter line, defended up on the leg side this time
tries to work this into an off side gap but too close to backward point
very full just outside off, driven out to deep cover
wide line outside off, slashed at and missed
tighter line, tries to run this down to third man and misses
managed to get this out on the off side, runs it to the deep cover
full length at the off stump, driven to short extra-cover
straighter line, worked wide of midwicket
little straight again, Duminy across his stumps to work through square leg
too short and straight, steered around the corner and finds the backward square rope to bring up the fifty stand
fuller and well outside off, left alone
similar wide line and left alone
slightly tighter line but once again, Duminy shouldering arms
two feet outside off on a length, Duminy forward but letting it go once more
slightly shorter length, punching from the crease Duminy gets it wide of deep cover and they run well for two
back of a length at the stumps, pulled off a big top edge, it whirls just over short long leg running back
fuller just outside off, this time ignored
tighter line, driven this time but straight to extra cover
even straighter and Duminy works this to midwicket
back across the off stump pressing a ball down to long-on
foot wide of off stump, driven out to deep cover
back of a length sliding across the left-hander who cuts out to deep cover
full length just outside off, Duminy waits and angles down to third man
long lean out to press this from just outside off to deep cover
around the wicket, length on off stump, just defended back to the bowler
shorter at the body, a steered pull gets a careful single down to long leg
back of a length just outside off, driven off the back foot to deep cover
length on off stump, forward pressing back to the bowler
touch shorter, cut straight to backward point
fuller angled in, almost beaten trying to flick to leg but gets an inside edge onto the pad which runs to backward point
length on off stump, forward press to extra-cover
straighter line and worked to short midwicket
leans out to drive a ball not all that short, finds backward point
full length on off stump, driven straight to extra-cover
straighter, also very full, worked to mid-on
short and wide, uppercut wide of backward point but too close to deep cover for a second
much fuller and back on off stump, flicked to mid-on
slower ball, driven steadily to extra-cover and oh dear terrible misfield and that's Miller's fifty in 75 balls, important innings
tighter line and a thick outside edge from an attempted back-foot drive flies fine of third man
full length just outside off, driven to deep cover for just a single
shorter length, this time Miller is back, punches out to deep cover and the 150 comes up
full and straight, gently nudged up the wicket, Sammy reaches out with a left hand but can't make a save so there's single inside mid-on
wider line, mistimed off side punch still lets them get a single in front of backward point
fuller length, driven carefully out to deep cover
slower ball, Miller a little early on the stroke pressing into the off side and almost chips a catch to short extra-cover
around the wicket, low full toss played wide of mid-on
shorter length played to extra-cover, misfield and they take a single
back of a length just outside off, guided in front of backward point
tighter line and just covers up in front of off stump
straighter and fuller, swept to short long leg, they run to the fielder
fuller length, clipped wide of short long leg for a quick single
full length just outside off, driven off a thickish inside edge down to long-on
shorter length and wide enough of off stump, guided wide of third man and they get back for two
again too wide of off stump but not wide enough of deep cover and they only get a single
full at the pad, Miller misses with a flick to leg, brief cry for lbw but it would have gone well down leg
just back of a length, quite tight to off stump, forced to backward point
this time forces it out to deep cover
around the wicket, short of a length, Miller goes to pull but gets a cue-end to mid-on, very early on that
full at the off stump, driven well back to bowler who gets down with a left-hand to save well
shorter again and pulled through midwicket, Gayle trots back but in the end leaves it for Johnson from deep square
yorker length, dug out to deep square
full length a foot outside off, left alone
short on a similar line, this time angled down to third man
slower ball from around the wicket onto off stump, tapped back up the wicket, Sammy gets a hand to it
straighter, flicked around the corner, they considered a single but Miller said no and Duminy had to get back quickly
full length just outside off, driven off a thick inside edge back to the bowler

drops the length back slightly, slower ball, Duminy through with the shot too soon and chips it back to the bowler! A smart catch reaching out with the right hand and Sammy breaks the partnership. Nice piece of bowling, Duminy deceived, trying to work down the ground and just tapped it back at shoulder height to the bowler
full length on off stump, gentle press back past the bowler for a quick single inside mid-on
touch straighter, this is clipped out to deep square
too wide to the man well set and he cracks it wide of the off side sweeper, nicely timed
fine delivery, angled into off stump and it holds it moves away off the seam to beat the outside edge, what an offcutter, deserved to take the edge! So close to the off stump too
straighter and tucked through square leg
bumper, right on line, well ducked
good length on off stump, blocked in the crease
shorter and pulled, in the air over the leg side but safely wide of the deep square
full length on the stumps, Miller well forward rolling this steadily down the ground, they take on mid-on for a second and get back easily
just outside off, Miller stays leg side of it and calmly pushes out to deep cover
full and straight, flicked back past the bowler, Sammy takes a tumble diving to his right and gets up rather gingerly
off stump line, nudged wide of deep backward square for a single
cutter around off stump, carefully nudged down to long-on
length ball angled in, Miller trying to find the leg side gap but Sammy himself get back to field
length on off stump, Berhardien in the crease trying to nudge out on the off side but can't get it anywhere
staying leg side of this trying to play off side again but too close to the bowler
little straight and turned down to third man
around the wicket, full on the off stump, flicked to midwicket
slower ball wide of off stump, driven out carefully to deep cover
short ball, rather awkwardly pulled off a toe-end to long leg
full on the stumps, clipped straight to midwicket
slower ball bumper outside off, left alone and Sammy is very unhappy that it's been called wide, looked a fair call
much fuller just outside off, driven steadily down to long-on
slightly back in length encourages Miller to pull, he does and gets it off an underedge through square leg
another slowie just outside off, driven through extra-cover and they can charge back for a third here with deep cover a long way to run around to his right
length ball a foot wide of off stump, Miller tries to cut from the crease but is beaten as it angles in a little
fuller length and driven down to long-on
full just outside off stump, driven straight to extra-cover
slower on the stumps, turned out through square leg, wide of the sweeper and they come back for two
good length on off stump, ran out to backward point
slower ball a foot outside off, rather dragged with a drive down to long-on
tight line just nudged up the wicket this man
pushed down the leg side
back of a length, pulled out to deep midwicket

good length on off stump, Berhardien plays all around it and loses his off stump! It nipped back a little bit but Berhardien was rooted in the crease sort of trying to run it down to third man but missed it by an awful long way and off stump was flattened. Pretty poor innings from Berhardien really
full and well wide of off stump, too wide in fact
brings the line back slightly but left again
driven from outside off, thick inside edge up towards mid-on, they take on the fielder for a sharp single
slower ball, offers width to work with and Miller works it wide of third man for a couple to bring the 200 up
length ball on off stump, worked wide of midwicket
fuller and wider of off stump, pushed off side but too close to point
full just outside off, rolled carefully through cover
bowler wider on the crease and bowls wider of off stump, Miller can only steer this to backward point
fuller length, Miller swing at it over cover but only for a single out to the sweeper
around the wicket, slower ball just outside off, Miller across his stumps to work a single through square leg
full and decent way outside off stump, swung at and missed, called wide which was harsh
much tighter to off stump, driven without much timing inside mid-on and they take a quick single
but this definitely is a wide, almost off the cut strip
fuller and definitely in play this time, off stump line, flicked up towards mid-off and they take a sharp single
slower ball, pushed from off stump towards mid-on and again they take a sharp single
back of a length, pulled wide of deep square who slides to his left and saves well and almost catches the batsmen out charging back for the second
full and very wide, slapped straight to backward point
low full toss, driven down the ground without timing so long-on has to come in a long way but they decline the second run
shiort ball, hooked at, Parnell was late on the stroke and it's in the air towards deep square but the fielder can't get in in time
much fuller, touched leg side and they get a single to end another healthy over
very full just outside off, missed trying to dig it out towards third man
similar length, this time jammed into midwicket and they get a single
right up there again but a bit wide, forced out wide of deep cover and Parnell runs well to get back for the second
yorker again, dug out into the covers, easy single
remains very full, this is a slower ball, Parnell spots it and flicks down the ground, long-on gets around to his right to save the second
length outside off, slapped only inside mid-off for a second run
a little straight and flicked through square leg
outside off not and Parnell forces this out to deep cover
angled in on a full length, whipped out towards deep square and they run hard for the second
goes to flick leg side again but is straight high on the pad and it runs down to third man
slower ball, touched into midwicket, they take on the fielder and a direct hit would have the batsman short at the non-striker's end
length on off stump, dropped through the covers and they take a simple single
full on the stumps, flicked leg side, wide of long-on and Miller comes back for the second to bring up a maiden ODi century, vital innings here today
slower ball outside off, goes to push through the covers but misses
too wide outside off this time
nice and full again but Miller is right back in his crease and slaps it past extra-cover, a welcome boundary wide of long-off
half-volley now and whacked over long-off for the first six of the innings, this is just what the hosts wanted, timed that perfectly into the trees
bowler responds with a yorker wide of off stump, Miller misses again
very full again, driven out through the off side but there's a straighter sweeper now and it's just a single
around the wicket, full on off stump, slapped way back over wide long-on, big strike that
back of a length, pulled through square leg, four more, placed that well behind the leg side sweeper
over the wicket, low full toss well outside off, reached for an nailed up and over the off side and it carries for six more over the cover sweeper
much better, yorker on off stump, dug out back to the bowler
slapped down to long-on, rather hacked from just outside off, didn't time it
slower ball on off stump, tapped forward into the cover and they get an easy single
full length outside off, big swing and a total miss, just get a single here surely?

yorker, Parnell trying to flick leg side missed and is bowled! Very nice delivery from Holder, right on line and Parnell played right across it out went middle stump. Again just try and get something on that to get Miller back on strike? Not great cricket from Parnell

steps right across the stumps and goes to scoop over the leg side but finds short long leg! Another wicket falls. Length ball, a cutter, a foot outside off, Phangiso took a big strike to his right and tried to clear the leg side infield but it went straight to the fielder
another yorker, a foot outside off, batsman misses, four dots now
low full toss this time, bunted down to long-on and finally Miller gets the strike back
around the wicket, full length, swung hard at and it goes high into the sky, who wants this? Holder himself runs back towards where mid-on would be but he can't quite get there

inn2.comm: big appeal first ball! Was full, hammered into the pad - perhaps the back one - and they go for the review. It was the back pad it struck, but suggest that's heading down the leg side. Not a great review, to be honest. Comfortably missing the stumps.
another huge appeal, this time for caught behind - I think. Jags back at Smith from short of a length and cuts him in half. Missed the bat, takes the top of the back pad. Not out on either count

that's out! It wasn't a contest. Touch fuller, 141kph, pitching around middle, straightens on Smith to beat the outside edge and smashes into middle stump. That is a comprehensive clean-up job. Smith playing an aggressive whip across the line, so didn't give himself the best chance but still a cracking delivery
very full outside off, trying to tempt the drive, Johnson leaves it alone
short of a length, nips back at Johnson who gets taken on the thigh pad...clocked at 147kph
fuller around middle, takes an inside edge into the pad to the leg side
full outside, 142kph, left alone
gets a fraction too straight, clipped off the pads down to fine leg
defended square into the off side
full on middle and off, pushed firmly to mid on
cracking delivery, pitched around off stump and scooted across to beat the edge although Gayle was trying to work it through midwicket with a closed face
fuller and wider outside off, Gayle leans into a drive which goes to the right of mid off
short of a length on off stump, 149kph - good heat, Gayle on the back foot and opens the face to beat backward point
full and wide, too wide, as Steve Davis exercises his arms
back of a length outside off, 145kph, Johnson shoulders arms
full and wide, this time he lures Johnson into the drive and the left hander gets beaten
defended to the leg side
finds the edge with a full ball as Johnson drives but it goes well wide of the slips to third man
full, outside off, 144kph and Gayle doesn't play
short of a length, Johnson tries to pull but gets taken in the lower part of the stomach via a bottom edge
full outside off, 138kph, left alone
back of a length, defended to the off side
tucks this into midwicket
pushed wider outside off, through to the keeper
driven square off the back foot to backward point
full around off stump, a good length to Gayle who is hanging back in the crease, defended to the covers
fuller, still, outside off this time, jabbed to backward point without much footwork
a shorter delivery, defended from deep in the crease back to Morkel
flicked away from off stump behind square on the leg side, a closed face again
full outside off, 146kph, left alone
this one zips off the surface and is on the rise as van Wyk takes it, but was a fraction too wide
back of a length, Gayle keen on the leg side again as he whips this with plenty of bottom hand to midwicket
now he cuts loose, offered a hint of width by Abbott and he takes advantage as he hammers it through cover off the back foot
gets squared up in defence this time, ends up on one leg for a second
angled across outside off, 139kph, left alone
fuller delivery, well bowled, almost catches Gayle out with a lack of footwork but he's able to defend to mid off
nips back off a good length, pushed towards mid on

and it's worked first ball! What a call from de Villiers. Pretty shocking stroke, mind. It's floated up outside off, smartly tempting Gayle, he comes forward to drive but is reaching for the ball and just ends up presenting a catch to cover, neat catch above the head
round the wicket, slanted across full outside off, driven to backward point
hint of turn there, takes Samuels on the pads
comes forward and defends
worked off the back foot to short midwicket
full and flicked down the ground to long on
short of a length, banged into the surface, Samuels fends it away with the bottom hand coming off the bat as it jars the handle. You can see it wobble on the slow-mo replay
driven off the back foot to point
short of a length, played into the off side
short ball, Samuels ducks...close to a wide
fantastic stroke, stands tall to a back-of-a-length delivery and drives it through the covers...staying on leg stump to open the off side
tucked off the pads to square leg
he succeeds where Gayle failed, lofts a full delivery over the off side...went straighter than Gayle tried, more mid off, and there was more commitment in the stroke
defended to backward point
on the back foot, played with soft hands
now he brings out a strong sweep, again fully committed to the shot, taken off around middle stump and beats deep square
leans well forward and defends to cover
hint of turn, takes a thick outer part of the bat to short third man
dabbed to the leg side
full and straight, defended to midwicket
flicked to the leg side, with the spin
touch of extra bounce from the rough, defended with a closed face
uses his feet then defends to the off side
down the pitch, flicked to the leg side, Phangiso dives across and fields very well...starts with a maiden
back of a length, defended to the covers
a bouncer, well directed, Samuels goes underneath
short and a touch wide outside off, cracked firmly to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, hint of swing and left alone

top edged, nearly a great catch! But Duminy has tumbled into the rope while holding the ball. Johnson pulled, went high into the air, Duminy position himself at deep square and held the catch but his momentum took him into the boundary and it's given a six
across onto off stump, defended to the leg side
round the wicket, defended to the off side
touch short on off stump, cut into the off side
over the wicket, full outside off, dribbles square into the leg side
cuts off the back foot to the cover sweepr
gets a fraction too straight and it slips down the leg side
more turn there, from the rough, as Johnson lunges forward to defend
appeal for lbw as he misses his sweep, didn't look a bad shout...maybe shading down the leg side
worked out to deep square
closes the fact and takes this into midwicket
excellent bouncer, over off stump and just over his head...Samuels turning his head out of the line, again, as he ducks the short ball
short of a length, tucked into midwicket
135kph, defended to the off side
good length outside off, left alone
round the wicket, angled into leg stump, flicked to the on side
touch shorter outside off, driven off the back foot to cover...de Villiers in the ring today
clipped off his pads but can't beat backward square
nice line, full outside off, draws him forward and the turn finds an inside edge to the leg side

oh dear, a mix-up costs West Indies. Pushed into the off side off the back foot, Johnson came down for the run but was sent back by Samuels. The throw from cover was swift - from de Villiers - and Johnson's dive wasn't enough. A word, too, for van Wyk who took the ball low by the stumps expertly.
cut out to deep cover
full on middle and off, defended to the leg side
back cuts a short delivery down to third man, decent pace at 142kph
short of a length, defended to the off side
moving to the leg side, then plays and misses at a length ball going across him...not convincing
bouncer, 139kph, he ducks
another bouncer, too short this time and called wide
driven off the back foot to deep cover
length on the stumps, tapped through square leg for a single
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
tighter line and just played back to the bowler
touch fuller, angled out to deep cover, well steered

full, straight, keeps a little low and Ramdin plumb in front! Nipped back a little, Ramdin back on his stumps and the umpire gave it out before the bowler could turn around. Stone dead, back pad, right in front of middle. Poor judgement from Ramdin, it skidded through and that's a plumb as you'll get
slip goes in, full length just outside off, pressed forward up to mid-off
length at the pads, turned only to square leg
stays leg side of this length ball on off stump, driven nicely and steers it past the dive of mid-off, timed well
pressed off side again, this time gently through cover for just a single
full length two feet wide of off stump, left alone
length ball sliding across the left-hander who shoulders arms
fuller length just outside off, forward press straight to cover
driven loosely from just outside off, in the air for a while but short of mid-on
fuller and straighter, driven into extra-cover
more leg stump and this time flicked wide of short long leg, they take a quick single
two feet wide of off stump, Carter shoulders arms
tighter line and slides past the outside edge, lovely bowling
touch fuller and driven in the air but well short of mid-off
length ball on the stumps, Samuels jumping back in his crease to defend up on the off side
fuller length and Samuels plays a beautiful straight drive down the ground, clean as a whistle over the bowler's head and it carries all the way for six
not as full but hammered down the ground once more, Samuels stepping to leg this time and belting this back past the bowler, timed well enough and this all along the floor
short ball but well wide of off stump, too wide in fact
length and straight, just defended again now but manages to knock it up on the off side for a short single
a foot and a bit outside off, left alone
tighter line, Carter leans out to press up the back to the bowler
full length just outside off, driven down to mid-on
back of a length, Carter onto it quickly and pulls to good effect backward of square, well timed
full length, Carter was aiming leg side and got a bit of a leading edge but it was all along the floor through point
straight line, turned to short long leg who saves well to his right side
length on the off stump, calmly patted back to the bowler
tad wider, Carter leans out to try and flick away on the off side and gets beaten
around the wicket, full on off stump, knocked into a gap in the covers for a quick single, oh no there isn't! Samuels sent back
sliding across the right-hander and beats the outside edge
straight and dabbed into square leg
leg side line, Samuels shoulders arms but it comes off his pad so no wide

played forward into the off side, who wants a single here? Only one of them! The batsmen are at the same end and Carter is run out by a pitch length. That is a shambles. Samuels drove firmly towards mid-off and took three steps down the track, Carter jogged down for the single but Samuels decided it wasn't on so stopped running, selling his partner down the river and there was an easy run out at the bowler's end
length on the stumps, clipped wide of short long leg
full length on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
wider line and driven out to deep cover
straight line tossed up, forward getting an inside edge through square leg
off stump line, driven straight back to the bowler
back on his stumps, angling this length ball to backward point
floated up outside off, slapped firmly, in the air for a while but short of backward point
around the wicket, off stump line, pressed to extra-cover
slides past the outside edge and keeps a little low to beat the keeper too
another one sliding on outside off, Sammy shaped to cut but left it in the end
further outside off and this time a wide
tighter line, Samuels finally connects with a cut, finds deep cover
leg stump line now, clipped out to deep square
tad short again and Samuels cuts once more to deep cover
stays back and almost gets done by one that skids on towards off stump, Sammy just gets the bat down in time to inside edge to short long leg
outside off now, hanging back again playing to extra-cover
tighter line, backs to leg and carves to backward point
more air, driven out to long-off
floated up on the stumps, pressed forward back to the bowler
bit more air, Sammy dabs it down on the off side looking for a single that isn't available
forward driving only to extra-cover
slightly tighter line and this is able to be driven down to long-off
steers this wide of extra-cover for a quick single
fuller and wide enough to drive past point, they get two as the sweeper runs to his left
middle and leg line, flicked to short long leg
tad short outside off, cut out to the off side sweeper
floated up just outside off, driven out to deep cover
straighter line and dabbed through square leg this time
little air just outside off, lifted over the covers with an in-to-out drive but just a single to the sweeper
flatter ball, driven along the ground to the cover sweeper this time
tighter line, defended back up the wicket
back to cut and almost slaps it to extra-cover, lands just short of the fielder
length just outside off, Samuels back angling this to backward point
length a foot outside off, angled down to third man
a touch straight and clipped out down to long leg
length on a straighter line, just blocked back to the bowler trying to work to leg
touch shorter, Samuels gets inside the line and tucks backward of square leg for a single
just back of a length and Samuels onto it in a flash, slapping a pull wide and over mid-on, a good thump, hundred up
stays leg side of a ball a shade outside off, carves down to third man
length on off stump, Sammy firm around off stump playing back to the bowler
short and pulled off a bit of a top edge but it flies into the stands over long leg, not really in control of the stroke at all
fuller length, clipped to midwicket who gets to his left and saves very well
length ball angled out down to third man
a foot outside off, cracked straight to backward point
length just outside off, played forward back to the bowler
wider outside off, Sammy shoulders arms
tighter line and driven but well saved at point and no single available
wider line, Sammy tries to hang back and cut but misses
similar length but a touch tighter and pressed out to deep cover
full length on off stump, driven well down the ground and finds a single to long-off
yorker length, dug out through square leg and they get a single
length ball, Sammy back on the off stump punching back to the bowling
touch fuller, half-forward is Sammy finding the bowler once more
slightly straighter line, pressed up to mid-on
fuller length, driven to mid-off this time
tries to drive this lavishly through the covers but misses
nice way to enter the BBB chair as Samuels slams a straight drive down the ground, again giving himself a touch of room to leg but held his shape on the shot...that's his fifty
nearly edges this, slanted across outside off and he had fiddle
good short ball, well-directed, over off stump and Samuels drops his hands
another short one, Samuels tries to ramp it down to third man but it was a slower ball, a cutter, and he was beaten by the lack of pace
yorker this time, dug out to the leg side
finishes with another bouncer which is ducked...good comeback after the first-ball boundary
excellent cut stroke, not a vast amount of width offered but he plays it beautifully late to bisect backward point and third man
push-and-run into the off stand and that's the fifty stand...been a good effort from this pair
back of a length, may have been another cutter, clubbed to midwicket
full outside off and Samuels has a wild mow while splaying his feet to the leg side
places this very well, short outside off and lofts it over the off side, wide mid-off area, to beat the sweeper...hard to describe the shot
full outside off, driven sweetly to the man on the rope
short of a length, opens the face towards backward point
stand and deliver! Another cracking stoke, this time from Sammy, as he dispatches a full delivery through the off side with fantastic power and placement
smart batting, places this into the off side for another single
on leg stump, takes the pad towards square leg
back of a length, pushed into the gap at cover
short of a length on leg stump, clipped behind square...another handy over for West Indies
round the wicket, full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
steps back to a shorter ball and drives to cover
brilliant stroke, excellent placement by Sammy as he opens the face at the last minute to loft this drive square over the off side...no one back on the boundary
fuller delivery, on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
hint of turn as Sammy pushes forward into the off side
holds this back a fraction, Sammy is just about to adjust a find some space in the off side for a quick single
wide outside off, he chases it hard and doesn't connect...called wide, perhaps a tad harsh
full outside off, hammered towards mid off where it reaches on one bounce
short of a length, nudged into the leg side
pulls a short ball and gets a bottom edge into his foot which then rolls into the off side, not far away from a drag-on
short outside off, helped over the off side to the sweeper
another wide one outside off which Sammy doesn't reach and another extra to the tally
powerful stroke, a strong drive to a length ball but superbly fielded on the edge of the ring by de Villiers
all the way! What a shot. Backs away to leg, it's short of a length and he upper cuts well over third man. Not the longest boundary, but will a mighty blow. Struck the roof of the stand
sprayed down the leg side
picks off another short ball, that is a sweet pull by Sammy which goes miles back over deep square leg...was basically a long hop, rather than a bouncer. Another ball is required, please
the runs are flowing in the Powerplay, this is full and angled into leg stump, Sammy is quite delicate this time is he clips it wide of short fine leg
better line, full on off stump, pushed into the off side to bring up a very well-compiled fifty. Was left out of the previous match
full, drilled down the ground with fierce power but straight to long on
slower ball, grips and bounces a touch, takes handle and glove into the off side
back of a length, whipped to deep square leg

the breakthrough, but only just! Sammy carves a full delivery high into the off side, de Villiers runs back from cover, the ball bobbled and he showed brilliant awareness to keep his eyes on it and grasp it as it fell by his chest
pushed across outside off, a swing and a miss from Samuels
gives himself a little room and angles this down to third man
width outside off, driven square through the off side and Russell takes on the sweeper's arm. Wins.
short of a length on off stump, 131kph, defended to the leg side
lovely placement, didn't seem to have the power off the bat but was placed superbly as he drove a full ball through straight cover and the sweeper had no chance
round the wicket, full, pushed down the ground
defended back to the bowler
angled into leg stump, takes the pad to the on side
pushed down to long off
nice footwork, gets to the pitch and drives down to long on
now Russell advances as well, drives with considerable power but straight to long off
defended to the off side
nicely bowled, but costs four. That's ODI cricket. Full around off stump, takes a thick outside edge along the ground fine of third man. Squared him up completely
what a blow! Just picked up off a good length and hoisted over midwicket. Dismissive from Russell
full and worked into the leg side
a huge swing across the line, only connects with fresh air, no need for that. Keep your head, Marlon
moving to the leg side, Morkel follows him and the ball goes between leg stump and the batsman...but it's a no-ball!
well bowled, full outside off, on the popping crease. Samuels had stayed on leg stump so could barely reach it
driven through the covers
pushed down the leg side, a gentle wide

he's done it! Much debate about Behardien's position in the side. Well, he may just have won the match here. A full delivery, nips back a touch and there was a massive gap with Samuels' feet planted on leg stump. Knocks back the leg pole
drifting into the batsman again on a full length, driven to cover
finds a thick inside, scoots wide of the stumps and a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have been close as well
no messing from Russell! Takes a full delivery from around off stump and launches it over wide long on
pushes into the off side to keep the strike
nicely bowled, slides past the outside edge playing forward just outside off
forward press and this time makes a connection, finds a single into the covers
full two feet outside off, Holder shoulders arms
too wide outside off now
fuller and back on a fourth-stump line, driven at, squirts this out to backward point
driven again but straight to extra-cover
seams away from the off stump, started wide as it was so penalised
over compensates, flick of the pad down to a very fine fine leg, makes the over decent now
length outside off stump, cut to the sweeper
tighter line, played forward to, thick inside edge through square leg, deep fielder in quickly to save the second
fuller length, driven towards backward point, du Plessis saves a second with a dive to his right
straight to du Plessis this time, more of a guided defensive shot
tighter line, swing into the pads, inside edge off the pad runs into the off side, almost got through
shorter length sliding across the right-hander, Russell stays leg side of it and angles past short third man
push and run to the left hand of mid-off, quick single
fuller, slapped down towards long-off, only one available
low full toss, clipped down to long-on this time and Russell charges back for a second
s step down the wicket, Duminy fired it wide of off stump but not wide enough, Holder leans out to it and slaps past extra-cover with good timing, wide of the sweeper
middle and leg stump line, worked to midwicket

low full toss, tried to clip it leg side but miscues it a little, taken by midwicket! A fantastic leaping catch with one hand above David Miller's head, a great leap, holds on really well. That should have gone into the stands but Holder was tentative, miscued the leg side flick and couldn't get it over midwicket's head
full ball rolled only back to the bowler
touch wider and played off side but only a single to the sweeper
slip in, back to a full ball and just keeps it out in front of off stump
straighter line, forward defence, gets a thick inside edge to the right of short long leg
angled in then it grips and turns away beating outside edge and off stump, a beauty
tries the same thing, Russell back this time to keep it out
full and drifts in towards middle and off, only defended up the wicket
tries to clear the front leg and swing over the leg side, this comes off high on the bat to mid-on
nicely bowled, gets it to go the other way this time and beats the outside edge with Brathwaite poking at it from the crease
gorgeous strike, a touch overpitched and a clean swing sends this way back into the stands down the ground, straight as a dye
get this to move away again and beats the outside edge once more, significant swing there
very full, dug out down to third man
length ball a foot outside off, swing at and missed backing away to leg
slides this down the leg side
very full a shade outside off, driven at and gets a thick edge down to third man
another big strike keeps this chase alive. A touch overpitched outside off and Russell swings another out of the ground, lovely clean strike over long-off, huge six
slower ball bumper, batsman gets in a pickle and it ends up harmlessly going through to the keeper
well bowled, yorker on leg stump, Russell gets something on it fine of third man, little outside edge looking to turn it to leg I think
dug in around off stump, well played up on his toes knocking this down towards point
great bumper, batsman falls on the floor swaying inside the line

length ball sliding across the right-hander, tries to guide to third man and dropped at slip! Bad drop really by de Villiers of all people to his right hand side, he got two hands at shoulder height but it bounced out
anther one across Russell and beats him this time, away swing again
too wide of off stump this time, cut at and missed
towards off stump and again it swings alarmingly away and beats the outside edge, this sudden swing is remarkable
tighter line, Russell tries to step to leg and carve on the off side but is beaten and the ball shaves the off stump too

fuller length, swing away again and edged behind! But Russell wants a review. It was given out by Steve Davis. No Hot Spot in this series but we have Real Time Snicko. Russell adamant that there was no edge. No obvious sound on the replay and nothing on RTS too, will this be overturned on this evidence? Yes it is! Russell survives and the match is still alive! Great time to still have the review left

middle and leg line, dabbed up on the leg side, no single there, Brathwaite sent back but de Villiers is there with the throw and Brathwaite is a long way out! No need for the third umpire. Brathwaite trying to get Russell back on strike but he's too keen and pays the price, nice fielding from de Villiers at midwicket to make up for the dropped catch
full length just outside off, driven down to long-off, well played
back in his crease and heaves it over long-on! Big strike. Tad short from the bowler, deep in his crease and hammered away
down the track and into the stands again!! Another huge strike over long-on, right to the pitch and bang, six more, fifty for Russell, can he get his side home now?
further outside off, driven powerfully out through cover, what a save by Miller at deep cover! Diving to his left saves four brilliantly
oh dear, slips down leg, wide

full, straighter line, tries to flick leg side and misses, it runs off the pads a short way into the off side, Cottrell is calling a sharp single and Russell is abel to steam up the other end to keep the strike!
length just outside off, steps to leg and carves past backward point! Flies to the boundary, what a shot, great timing, no chance for deep cover, length not the best option from Abbott
great yorker, well dug out back to the bowler, Russell almost falls out of his ground, Abbott throw missed anyway
full on the stumps and IT'S OUT OF THE GROUND!!! What a victory, what a performance from Andre Russell. Abbott misses his length and Russell does the rest, whacking it way back over long-on!
